definitions.definition: a baby or very young child

examples.text: a nursery for infants under two
She was seriously ill as an infant.
Mozart was an **infant prodigy** *(= a young child with unusual ability)*.
Marjorie looked down at the sleeping infant in her arms.
a book on intellectual development in the human infant
We studied newborn infants up to two months old.

definitions.definition: a child at school between the ages of four and seven

examples.text: The majority of infant teachers are women.
I've known her since we were in the infants *(= at  school)*.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French enfant, from Latin infant- ‘unable to speak’, from in- ‘not’ + fant- ‘speaking’ (from the verb fari).
